ch.icare.smartscan

Class SmartScanner

  • java.lang.Object
    • ch.icare.smartscan.SmartScanner
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    android.view.SurfaceHolder.Callback

    public class SmartScanner
extends java.lang.Object
implements android.view.SurfaceHolder.Callback
    This class is used to interact with the SmartScan library. Changelog v1.1 : - added a new listener callback called when the library and camera have been sucessfully loaded. v2.0 : - switch to Android Studio, lot of optimizations and improvements - code definition constants moved to SmartScanner class instead of decoding lib v2.0.1 : - remove of deprecated/useless methods (adjustRegionOfInterest) - improved method to determine preferred ROI

    • Constructor Detail

      • SmartScanner

        public SmartScanner(android.content.Context ctx)
        Instantiate the SmartScanner object.
        Parameters:
        ctx - Context. Application Context will be derived from this to avoid leaks.

    • Method Detail

      • setOnResultListener

        public void setOnResultListener(OnDecoderResultFoundListener listener)

      • setOnLoadedListener

        public void setOnLoadedListener(OnDecoderLoadedListener listener)

      • setOnErrorListener

        public void setOnErrorListener(OnDecoderErrorListener listener)

      • getContext

        public android.content.Context getContext()

      • getIcareDecodersSDKDescription

        public java.lang.String getIcareDecodersSDKDescription()
        Prints the native SDK build description. A safe place to call this method is in your implementation of {link OnDecoderLoadedListener.onDecoderLoaded() OnDecoderLoadedListener.onDecoderLoaded }.

      • setContinuousDecoding

        public void setContinuousDecoding(boolean isContinuousDecoding)
        Restarts decoding as soon as a result has been found, without manual call to restartDecoding. Default is false.
        Parameters:
        isContinuousDecoding - true if the decoder should decode continuously, false to pause after result

      • setBeepOn

        public void setBeepOn(int beepResId)
        Enables and set the beep sound when a scan is done.
        Parameters:
        beepResId - int resource id of the sound file.

      • setVibrateOn

        public void setVibrateOn(boolean enabled)
        Enables the vibration when a scan is done.

      • setFlashEnabled

        public boolean setFlashEnabled(boolean isFlashEnabled)
        Enables/Disables the flashlight LED during the scanning process

      • isFlashAvailable

        public boolean isFlashAvailable()
        Checks if flashlight is available on device. It's better to call this method after init because it needs to access the camera instance. For example, a safe place to call this method is in your implementation of {link OnDecoderLoadedListener.onDecoderLoaded() OnDecoderLoadedListener.onDecoderLoaded }. For a more straightforward but less reliable method, you can use getPackageManager().hasSystemFeature(PackageManager.FEATURE_CAMERA_FLASH) on your activity.
        Returns:
        true if flashlight is available, false otherwise. If camera is not initialized, returns false.

      • setDecodingType

        public void setDecodingType(int decodingType)
        Sets the decoder to use. Also set the default region of interest for that code type. Use int as defined in SmartScanner Bitwise combinations can be used to specify multiple decoding types.
        Note that you will only be able to read codes types authorized by the library. This will also set the preffered region of interest.

      • setRegionOfInterest

        public void setRegionOfInterest(android.graphics.Rect rect)
        Allows to manually set the region of interest.
        Parameters:
        rect - Rect representation of the region of interest

      • setSurfaceView

        public void setSurfaceView(android.view.SurfaceView surfaceView)
        Defines the SurfaceView holding the camera preview, inside your layout.
        Parameters:
        surfaceView - SurfaceView view instance

      • setCanvasDrawer

        public void setCanvasDrawer(CanvasDrawerInterface canvasDrawer)
        Sets the CanvasDrawer, ie. the view that displays the target.
        This View must implement CanvasDrawerInterface.
        It is set in the activity layout.
        This canvas view is not mandatory.
        Parameters:
        canvasDrawer - view that implement CanvasDrawerInterface

      • getHandler

        public ch.icare.smartscan.camera.SmartScannerHandler getHandler()
        Gets the smartscanner app thread Handler that binds with decoding thread
        Returns:
        SmartScannerHandler

      • getCameraManager

        public ch.icare.smartscan.camera.CameraManager getCameraManager()
        Gets CameraManager used to interact with the device
        Returns:
        CameraManager

      • getVersion

        public static final java.lang.String getVersion()
        Displays smartscan java library information.
        Returns:
        String

      • setCamera

        public void setCamera(int cameraId)
        Sets the camera to use. If not set, will use the first back facing camera. On old devices (API 8, 2.2), this setting won't do anything.
        Parameters:
        cameraId - int camera id. On most devices 0 is the first back facing camera.

      • init

        public void init()
        Initializes the SmartScanner library objects and processes. Must be called in onResume() of the main activity, after the call to super(). When init is done, a call to OnDecoderLoadedListener#onDecoderLoaded(Rect), OnDecoderLoadedListener.onDecoderLoaded occurs.

      • release

        public void release()
        This methods frees memory by releasing objects and processes used by SmartScanner. Must be called in onPause() of the main activity, before the call to super();

      • handleDecoderResult

        public void handleDecoderResult(DecodedResult decodedResult)
        A valid result has been found, so execute callback if given. OnDecoderResultFoundListener#onResultFound(DecodedResult), OnDecoderResultListener.onResultFound Restarts decoding if continuous decoding is enabled. This method is called internally.
        Parameters:
        decodedResult - DecodedResult object

      • restartDecoding

        public void restartDecoding()
        Restarts the decoding process. Useful if a result has been found and setContinuousDecoding is false.

      • pauseDecoding

        public void pauseDecoding()
        Pauses the decoding process. Could be restarted with restartDecoding.

      • surfaceChanged

        public void surfaceChanged(android.view.SurfaceHolder holder,
                           int format,
                           int width,
                           int height)
        Specified by:
        surfaceChanged in interface android.view.SurfaceHolder.Callback

      • surfaceCreated

        public void surfaceCreated(android.view.SurfaceHolder holder)
        Specified by:
        surfaceCreated in interface android.view.SurfaceHolder.Callback

      • surfaceDestroyed

        public void surfaceDestroyed(android.view.SurfaceHolder holder)
        Specified by:
        surfaceDestroyed in interface android.view.SurfaceHolder.Callback

      • getRegionOfInterest

        public android.graphics.Rect getRegionOfInterest()
        Get current region of interest. Null if camera is not initialized.
        Returns:
        Rect object defining the region of interest

      • getRecommendedROIRatio

        public double getRecommendedROIRatio(int codeType)
        Returns the recommended ratio for decoding target, to avoid other signs disturbing the decoding process. This is only an indication and is what is used by default when #setDecodingType(int), setDecodingType is called.
        Parameters:
        codeType -
        Returns:
        double ratio (width/height)
